meanings.definition: Feel intense or passionate dislike for someone.
meanings.sent1: She haets the taste of broccoli.
meanings.sent2: I haets when people talk loudly on the phone.
meanings.sent3: He haets Mondays more than anything else.
meanings.sent4: The cat haets getting wet in the rain.
meanings.sent5: The teacher haets when students don't pay attention in class.

meanings.sent1: Her haets towards spiders is well-known.
meanings.sent2: The rivalry between the two teams was filled with haets.
meanings.sent3: The haets between the neighbors over the fence were legendary.
meanings.sent4: The haets in the air were palpable during the argument.
meanings.sent5: The haets in his eyes were unmistakable as he glared at his opponent.

meanings.sent1: She haets the way he always interrupts her.
meanings.sent2: He haets when people don't follow the rules.
meanings.sent3: The dog haets being left alone at home.
meanings.sent4: The tree haets being pruned every year.
meanings.sent5: The child haets having to eat vegetables for dinner.
